job_description:
Web Developer

Job Summary:

Hotpack is seeking a talented and innovative Web Developer to join our dynamic IT department. The ideal candidate will be a versatile professional with a strong background in both front-end and back-end development, coupled with a keen eye for UI/UX design. You will be responsible for developing, managing, and enhancing our diverse digital ecosystem, including our multiple Shopify e-commerce stores, corporate websites, and critical internal platforms like our company-wide intranet. This role is perfect for a proactive problem-solver who is passionate about leveraging technology to drive business growth, improve efficiency, and deliver exceptional user experiences.

Key Responsibilities

  1. E-commerce & Web Development:
    • Develop, maintain, and customize multiple Shopify-based e-commerce stores for the GCC region, creating custom themes, sections, and pages using Liquid, HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript.
    • Design and implement reusable, scalable, and high-performance web components to ensure consistency and streamline future development.
    • Manage end-to-end web development projects, from conception and design to deployment and ongoing maintenance.
  2. Backend & Systems Automation:
    • Enhance backend functionalities and integrate automation tools to improve the scalability, performance, and operational efficiency of our web platforms.
  3. UI/UX & Design Leadership:
    • Lead UI/UX design initiatives for all corporate and e-commerce websites, ensuring a seamless, engaging, and user-centric experience.
    • Create fully responsive and accessible web layouts that provide an optimal viewing experience across all devices (desktop, tablet, mobile), adhering to modern web standards.
  4. Strategic & Internal Development:
    • Collaborate closely with management, marketing, and other departments to align web and design strategies with overarching business objectives.
    • Continuously research and introduce new technologies, frameworks, and digital process improvements to strengthen Hotpack' online presence and internal efficiency.
    • Provide high-level technical and digital support to various departments, acting as a key resource for innovation and problem-solving.

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Web Development, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Proven 3 - 4 years of experience as a Web Developer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of web projects.
  • Expert proficiency in front-end technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and Liquid.
  • Extensive, hands-on experience with the Shopify platform, including theme customization, app integration, and API usage.
  • Strong understanding of UI/UX principles, responsive design, and web accessibility standards (WCAG).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on complex projects.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with experience working alongside non-technical teams like marketing and management.

Preferred Qualifications (A Plus)

  • Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Vue.js, or Angular).
  • Knowledge of server-side languages (e.g., Node.js, Python, PHP).
  • Experience in developing and managing intranet portals or signature tools.
  • Familiarity with the e-commerce landscape and consumer behaviour at the global level.
  • Experience with project management tools and agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with backend development concepts and integrating with APIs.

Contact:

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at stephy.t@hotpackglobal.com
summary: Hotpack seeks a Web Developer with e-commerce experience to enhance digital platforms. Responsibilities include front-end, back-end, and UI/UX development for Shopify stores and corporate sites.

job_description:
QA Lead

Company: NewAgeSys IT (a division of NewAgeSys) Location: Carnival Infopark, Phase 2, Kakkanad, Ernakulam Job Type: Onsite Shift Timing: 11 AM - 8 PM

About the Company: NewAgeSys IT, a division of NewAgeSys, Inc. (established 1994, New Jersey), specializes in mobile app development and consulting. They help clients maximize business reach and effectiveness using the latest technology. As a full-service mobile and web development firm, NewAgeSys IT serves clients across North America, UK, Europe, the Middle East, Singapore, and Australia. They build long-term client relationships, from initial brainstorming and strategy to building, deploying, supporting, and maintaining cost-effective solutions.

Job Description

NewAgeSys IT is seeking a detail-oriented and experienced QA Lead to head their Quality Assurance efforts. The ideal candidate will own test planning, execution, and process improvements to ensure projects meet the highest standards of quality, performance, and reliability. This role involves leading a team of QA engineers, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and implementing best practices to strengthen QA processes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and mentor a team of QA engineers (~10 members), fostering a culture of ownership, accountability, and continuous improvement.
  • Define, implement, and maintain QA processes, standards, and best practices across various web and Mobile app projects.
  • Develop and execute comprehensive test strategies including functional, regression, integration, performance, and automation testing (when required).
  • Collaborate closely with Project, Development, and DevOps teams to ensure seamless delivery.
  • Manage test planning, test case design, execution, and defect management.
  • Evaluate and recommend automation frameworks, tools, and technologies to improve efficiency.
  • Ensure QA involvement throughout the SDLC (Agile/Scrum methodologies).
  • Drive root cause analysis and continuous feedback loops to prevent recurring issues.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5–8 years of QA experience, with at least 2–3 years in a leadership or lead role.
  • Strong knowledge of manual and automated testing methodologies.
  • Hands-on experience with test automation tools such as Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Appium, JUnit, TestNG, or similar.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, version control (Git), and build tools (Jenkins, Maven, Gradle, etc.).
  • Experience with API testing tools (Postman, RestAssured, etc.) and performance testing tools (JMeter, Gatling, etc.).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Knowledge of cloud-based testing (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
  • ISTQB or similar certification is an advantage.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments.
  • Exposure to security testing and DevOps practices.
  • Previous experience in leading QA teams.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at career@newagesysindia.com
summary: Experienced QA Lead needed to head quality assurance efforts, lead a team, and improve QA processes. Requires 5-8 years of QA experience with strong automation and leadership skills.

job_description:
MDM Architect - Opening

Role Summary: We are seeking an experienced Data Governance & Master Data Management (MDM) leader to drive our enterprise-wide data strategy, governance framework, and master data management initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in data governance, data quality, metadata management, and MDM tools to ensure trusted, well-managed, and high-quality data that supports critical business decisions and digital transformation.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Governance - Establish and lead the enterprise data governance framework, policies, and standards. - Define and monitor data ownership, stewardship, and accountability models. - Develop and enforce data classification, privacy, and security policies aligned with regulatory and compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, BFSI regulations). - Drive adoption of data cataloging, lineage, and metadata management practices. - Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to ensure data is accurate, consistent, and compliant across the enterprise.

Master Data Management (MDM) - Define and implement the MDM strategy, operating model, and governance framework. - Lead MDM solution design, configuration, and integration with enterprise applications (ERP, CRM, Data Lakes, etc.). - Manage data domains (Customer, Product, Vendor, Employee, etc.) ensuring data consistency and standardization. - Oversee data quality management processes including profiling, cleansing, matching, merging, and survivorship rules. - Partner with technical teams to ensure scalable, secure, and high-performing MDM implementations (Profisee, Informatica, Reltio, Boomi, etc.).

Leadership & Stakeholder Management - Engage senior business leaders to align data initiatives with business goals. - Lead a cross-functional team of data stewards, analysts, and architects. - Provide thought leadership on data-driven decision-making and advanced data management practices. - Drive change management and foster a culture of data ownership across the organization.

Required Skills & Qualifications: - 10–15 years of experience in Data Governance, Data Quality, and MDM. - Strong expertise in enterprise data governance frameworks (DAMA-DMBOK, DCAM, ISO 8000/25500). - Hands-on experience with MDM platforms (Profisee, Informatica, Reltio, Semarchy, SAP MDG, Boomi MDM, etc.). - Experience in metadata management, lineage tools, and data catalogs (Collibra, OvalEdge, Purview, Alation, Informatica EDC). - Deep understanding of data modeling, data architecture, and integration patterns. - Proven track record of delivering enterprise-scale MDM programs across multiple domains. - Strong knowledge of data compliance and regulatory requirements (GDPR, BCBS239, SOX, HIPAA, etc.). - Excellent stakeholder management, leadership, and communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications: - Certification in Data Governance / MDM (e.g., DAMA CDMP, DCAM, Informatica MDM, Profisee Certified, Collibra Certified). - Experience working in Banking, Financial Services, Insurance, or Manufacturing domains. - Exposure to cloud-based MDM and governance solutions (Azure Purview, AWS Glue, GCP Dataplex, Fabric with OneLake). - Experience in AI/ML-driven data quality and governance initiatives.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at Keerthana.jayaraj@aspiresys.com
summary: Seeking an experienced MDM leader to drive enterprise data strategy and governance. Role involves leading MDM initiatives, ensuring data quality, and managing data domains.

About Us

Kvaliteta Systems and Solutions, based in Technopark, Trivandrum, is a global IT solutions provider offering a wide range of services, including Digital Transformation, Private Cloud, Infrastructure, Security, and Software Development as a Service. We enable businesses to thrive in the digital era by providing cutting-edge technology solutions.

We are seeking an experienced Software Test Engineer who can assist and empower their development team to deliver with your expertise in creating comprehensive test cases and ensuring the functionality, performance, and security of our platform. The role will focus on testing for different user personas, Java/j2EE, React and Node.js applications, API access, and system integrations.

Experience Required

3+ Years

Job Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, maintain, and execute manual and automated test cases.
  • Test Case Development: Create detailed unit tests and other test cases tailored to different user personas who log into the platform, ensuring that each role and group functions as expected, and ensuring front-end and back-end components operate correctly and cohesively.
  • API Access Testing: Test API access and interactions based on permissions and roles, ensuring that security and data access control are properly enforced across different user profiles.
  • Performance Testing: Conduct performance testing, focusing on page load times and overall platform responsiveness, identifying areas where optimization is required.
  • Integration Testing: Test the integration of external systems such as API servers and SSO (Single Sign-On) integrations, ensuring data flows smoothly between systems and functions as expected.
  • Permissions and Role-Based Testing: Validate role-based access and permissions for various user personas, ensuring that different user roles have the appropriate level of access to features and data.
  • Regression Testing: Perform regular regression testing to ensure that new features or bug fixes do not negatively affect the existing functionality of the platform.
  • Security Testing: Ensure that security protocols, including authentication and authorization mechanisms, work properly and safeguard the system from vulnerabilities.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with developers, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand requirements and provide detailed feedback on potential issues by identifying and documenting defects, tracking issues, and collaborating with the development team for resolution.
  • Design and implement automated tests for web and mobile applications and maintain automated testing frameworks to streamline the testing process, especially for repetitive and critical functionality.
  • Work with the development team to enhance automation and manual testing processes.
  • Ensure high-quality standards through best testing practices.

Senior Angular Developer

Company: DeviceDriven India (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabha, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum, 695581 Website: http://www.devicedriven.com Contact Email: jobs@devicedriven.com Job Published: 20, Oct 2025 Closing Date: 20, Nov 2025

Brief Description

DeviceDriven is contributing engineering expertise to a major fintech-led digital transformation initiative focused on modernizing a global-scale loyalty, rewards, and engagement platform. The platform enables millions of secure, real-time transactions across ecosystems such as travel, retail, gift cards, and digital assets — powering data-driven, scalable, and seamless customer experiences for leading financial institutions. Built on the foundations of cloud-native architecture, micro frontends, and AI-augmented development, the program is redefining how next-generation fintech platforms deliver user experiences at scale.

What You’ll Work On

You’ll join a high-impact frontend engineering team responsible for:

  • Re-architecting and enhancing responsive, data-rich Angular applications used by global banking and loyalty customers.
  • Integrating RESTful and GraphQL APIs from a microservice-based backend in real time.
  • Implementing dynamic UI workflows for redemption, travel booking, and partner product catalogs.
  • Leveraging AI-assisted coding tools (OpenAI, GitHub Copilot, Amazon Q, Claude) to accelerate delivery, improve test coverage, and optimize code quality.
  • Integrating observability and analytics into frontend modules for actionable user insights.
  • Collaborating with UX, QA, backend, and DevOps teams in an agile, data-driven development model.

Core Responsibilities

  • Design and build high-performance, modular UIs using Angular and TypeScript.
  • Develop reusable components, libraries, and shared frameworks aligned with enterprise standards.
  • Integrate with backend REST/GraphQL APIs, ensuring efficient data handling and state management.
  • Implement unit, integration, and end-to-end tests (Karma, Jasmine, Cypress, Playwright).
  • Apply AI-assisted workflows for code generation, linting, and test automation.
  • Work closely with design, QA, and DevOps to ensure CI/CD pipeline integration, accessibility, and performance.

Required Experience

6–12 years of frontend development experience with Angular and Angular JS and a strong foundation in JavaScript/TypeScript.

Technical Expertise

  • Core Frameworks: Angular 9+ (mandatory), AngularJS (legacy), ReactJS (advantage), Node.js, Express
  • Languages & Tools: TypeScript, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, CSS3, SCSS, LESS, Bootstrap, Material Design
  • Architecture: Micro frontends, Angular Universal (SSR), modular component libraries
  • State Management: NgRx / Redux / Akita
  • Testing: Karma, Jasmine, Protractor (legacy), Jest, Cypress, Playwright
  • Cloud & DevOps: AWS (S3, CloudFront, Cognito, API Gateway), Docker, Jenkins, GitHub Actions
  • AI & Productivity Tools: GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude for intelligent code completion, test generation, and documentation
  • Analytics & Observability: Integration with BI and tracking tools (Google Analytics, Segment, Mixpanel, Grafana dashboards)
  • Security & Performance: OWASP guidelines, CSP, XSS prevention, JWT/OAuth2 for secure API communication

Bonus Experience

  • Exposure to fintech, loyalty, or e-commerce frontends (redemption, catalog, checkout workflows).
  • Experience building white-label UI systems with configurable themes and modular branding.
  • Familiarity with hybrid app frameworks (React Native) for extending web apps to mobile.
  • Experience working alongside backend teams using Java/Spring Boot APIs.
  • Proficiency in CI/CD optimization, bundle analysis, and web performance tuning.

How to Apply

Send your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and a short introduction to: jobs@devicedriven.com
summary: Seeking a Senior Angular Developer for a fintech digital transformation. Responsibilities include re-architecting Angular applications, integrating APIs, and using AI tools.

job_description:
Lead Business Analyst

Company: DeviceDriven India (P) Ltd Location: Padmanabha, Technopark Campus, Trivandrum , 695581 Website: http://www.devicedriven.com Contact Email: Jobe@deviceDriven.com Job Published: 20,Oct 2025 Closing Date: 20,Nov 2025

Brief Description

DeviceDriven is contributing business and engineering expertise to a major fintech-led digital transformation initiative focused on modernizing a global-scale loyalty, rewards, and engagement platform. The platform powers millions of secure, real-time transactions across ecosystems such as travel, retail, gift cards, and digital assets — delivering data-driven, scalable, and frictionless experiences for consumers and enterprise banking partners.

What You’ll Work On

As a Lead Business Analyst, you’ll bridge business strategy and technology execution — owning the end-to-end requirements lifecycle and guiding cross-functional teams toward measurable delivery outcomes. You’ll work closely with client stakeholders, product owners, solution architects, and engineering leads to define and evolve the platform’s capabilities across earning, redemption, catalog management, and customer engagement workflows.

You’ll be responsible for:

  • Leading requirements definition across multiple business domains — loyalty, rewards, payments, and partner integrations.
  • Translating strategic goals into detailed user stories, epics, and acceptance criteria for development and QA teams.
  • Facilitating workshops with banking clients and internal product teams to capture and refine business needs.
  • Defining and documenting API-level and system integration requirements, working closely with backend and frontend teams.
  • Analyzing end-to-end customer journeys, identifying process gaps, and proposing optimization opportunities.
  • Collaborating on UAT planning, test coverage validation, and release readiness reviews.
  • Leveraging AI-assisted tools to streamline documentation, traceability, and change management.
  • Acting as a functional SME for developers and testers during sprints and releases.

Preferred Skills

Required Experience

  • 10–15 years of progressive experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, or Functional Consultant, ideally within fintech, loyalty, or e-commerce platforms.

Core Responsibilities

  • Own the requirements backlog, ensuring alignment with business value, priorities, and delivery timelines.
  • Develop and maintain BRDs, FRDs, user stories, wireframes, and data flow diagrams.
  • Translate business processes into API specifications and data mapping documents.
  • Work with architecture teams to ensure technical feasibility and alignment with the platform roadmap.
  • Coordinate across product, QA, and engineering to maintain end-to-end traceability and test coverage.
  • Support UAT execution and production validation, ensuring acceptance criteria and KPIs are met.
  • Manage change requests, impact analysis, and stakeholder communication with clarity and precision.
  • Mentor junior business analysts and contribute to standards for documentation and analysis practices.

Technical & Domain Expertise

  • Domain: Loyalty & rewards, payments, banking, fintech ecosystems
  • Tools: JIRA, Confluence, Figma/Miro (journey mapping), Postman (API validation), Power BI / Excel for data reporting
  • Documentation: BRDs, FRDs, user stories, acceptance criteria, data mapping, and system flow diagrams
  • Technical Awareness: REST APIs, JSON, SQL (querying and data validation), microservices, cloud (AWS/GCP)
  • AI Productivity: ChatGPT, GitHub Copilot, Claude, or similar tools for documentation, summarization, and test data creation
  • Methodology: Agile/Scrum delivery, DevOps-aligned processes

Bonus Experience

  • Experience defining white-label product requirements for financial institutions.
  • Familiarity with customer data platforms (CDP), analytics, or personalization engines.
  • Understanding of compliance, data protection, and audit requirements in fintech.
  • Ability to conduct competitive benchmarking and contribute to roadmap prioritization.
  • Exposure to AI/ML-enabled analytics or predictive customer engagement use cases.

How to Apply

Send your resume, LinkedIn profile, and a short introduction to: jobs@devicedriven.com
summary: Lead Business Analyst to modernize a global fintech loyalty platform. Owns requirements lifecycle, guides teams, and translates strategy into detailed user stories.
